section.title: Introduction
section.para: The &alp; (&alpshort;) is distributed either as a disk image of the &alpshort; installer named &dinstaller;, or as a pre-built &alpshort; raw disk image.

section.title: &dinstaller;
section.para: While &dinstaller; handles both bare-metal and virtualized deployments, it is a preferred method for bare-metal deployments. &alpshort; deployment using &dinstaller; is similar to a traditional operating system setup. After booting the &dinstaller; image, the installer uses a graphical user-friendly interface to walk you through the system configuration and deployment.

section.title: Raw disk image
section.para: This method handles both bare-metal and virtualized deployment as well. It is different from the &dinstaller; deployment in that you do not boot an installer but the actual &alpshort; image itself. On first boot, you can configure basic system options using an ncurses user interface. Using a raw disk image, you can fine-tune the deployment setup with &combustion; and &ignition; tools.

section.title: Hardware requirements
section.para: The minimum supported hardware requirements for deploying &alpshort; follow:

listitem.para: The maximum number of CPUs supported by software design is 8192.
&alpshort; requires at least 1 GB RAM. Bear in mind that this is a minimal value for the operation system, the actual memory size depends on the workload.
The minimum hard disk space is 12 GB, while the recommended value is 20 GB of hard disk space. Adjust the value according to the workloads of your containers.
